intro: Centaurea rhaponticoides, commonly known as the rhapontic centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright blue to violet flowers. Its flowers are arranged in dense, conical clusters, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea rhaponticoides is often found in dry meadows, grasslands, and rocky soils, where it thrives in full sun.
